result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedro B. Jasso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 1:37 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Pedro B. Jasso in court, in custody, with Attorney John P. Marchan. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment & treatment; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses or other drug testing at least 1x/month
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent or incidental contact for educational or employment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge whether or not sample is taken
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $50 drug testing fee, joint & several with Tiana Jones
--To reimburse $50 buy money, joint & several with Tiana Jones

Days credit for time already served: 20 days
Sentence may transfer to Dane County as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:58am. 
Defendant Pedro B. Jasso in court, in custody, with Attorney John P. Marchan. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Marchan indicates that he met with Mr. Jasso yesterday, but found it very hard to communicate with him because he is in alot of physical pain. Mr. Jasso is scheduled, through the Jail,  to see the doctor today.  Attorney Marchan is obtaining medical record information from the Jail.  
Attorney Marchan requests that the case be scheduled for change of plea in approximately one week.
recess 9:01am. 

NEXT:  schedule Plea/Sentencing Hearing on 9/29/14 at 1:30pm.
Status conference on September 18, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Conflict review worksheet

Case called at 1:16 pm
Defendant Pedro B. Jasso in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews procedural posture of the case and notes a previous conflict review done by this Court on 7/1/14. Court finds no additional record needs to be made regarding that review.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint.
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the address on the file is the correct address, defendant does live at that address.
Attorney De La Rosa confirms that Attorney Marchan does remain as attorney of record.
Court finds that the bench warrant to be executed by the defendant's appearance today, warrant should be withdrawn from any database it was entered into.

Court converts the signature bond to a $500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
--with previous non- monetary conditions

Recess: 1:28 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Br. 1 for further scheduling
Duplicate original warrant returned//def in custody
Extradition forecast

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:48am. 
Attorney John P. Marchan in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes that the US Postal Service returned the mailing of the notice of today's hearing, with an indication that the house is vacant.  
DA Happ points out that Mr. Jasso failed to appear at the 6/23/14 Preliminary Hearing. 
Attorney Marchan explains that Mr. Jasso told him, in a previous telephone conversation, the Sprague Road address is a house that belongs to a friend of his that is being rehabilitated--it has no electricity or plumbing currently, but Mr. Jasso is staying there. 
The Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant-body only. 
recess 8:50am.

Defendant's Notice of Hearing for the 9/9/14 Status Conference

Mailed to: W350 S9591 Sprague Road Eagle, WI 53119
Returned by USPS: Return to Sender/ Vacant/ Unable to Forward
States demand w/cover letter
from Def. Counsel re: Def. new address (address already on file)

case called at 3:18pm. 
Defendant Pedro B. Jasso in court with Attorney John P. Marchan.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr.  Jasso waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:

--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered on Count #2
Attorney Marchan provides a new address in Eagle, WI for Mr. Jasso.
recess 3:21pm.

[Clerk KG]
Case called at 1:19 pm.  

Defendant Pedro B. Jasso in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney John P. Marchan. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews Procedural Posture of the case.
Court reviews Conflict Review Worksheet. The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Jasso. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed. Court finds no conflict and signs the Conflict Review Worksheet. 

Attorney Marchan informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
The Court Orders the previously set signature bond be reinstated.

Court finds the bench warrant to be satisfied by Mr. Jasso's appearance. It should be removed from any database in which it is entered. 

Recess: 1:34 pm

NEXT: 
Preliminary Hearing- 7-14-14 at 3:30 pm

case called at 1:12pm. 
Defendant Pedro B. Jasso in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
